rComments: It bugs me that everyone thought this class was so hard, and failed. I truly think that is because they just never opened their book. Very interesting material, awesome class to the max, not tough. I wasn?t crazy over or idolized Nate like most (especially girls) did. He was just your average teacher-funny though; granted, he knew his stuff.
Nate is one of the best professors I have had at UCSC. He is extremely intelligent, very articulate, and has a great sense of humor. This class was tough, but I loved every second of it!!
He is the most inspiring teacher I've ever had.
Class was very interesting! The labs were very cool and extremely useful. Lots of material however and A LOT of memorization on bones, muscles, attachments, origins so don't get behind
Nate is awesome. Scary at first because he's so smart, but an amazing guy. Loves his work.

I'm a pretty hard critic on professors, but the guy is one of the best professors i've had. It's a ten unit class, and it does deserve that ten unit mark. Test are based on on lab handouts, so no surprises. No complaints on this guy, and thats rare for me.

Fabulous class!  Fabulous teaching style!  His tests are on the hard side, but not if you attend class, study hard, and talk to him!  He somehow manages to go through the lecture in a slowly yet quickly covers material, it's very odd but great.  He is incredibly knowledgeable (seriously a walking talking textbook!) and is very nice, helpful, and th

Very hard class with grade based of of exams only. Interesting material, but a lot to memorize and understand. I am very frustrated with his teaching style. He admitted that he didn't teach it the way he wanted. He will work with students, and seems nice, but he doesn't really answer his e-mails. I will be glad to get this class over.

Nathaniel is a very good teacher. Tests are fair, tho you should stay alert. He is still learning and developing his practice (as are we all) and his circumstantial objectivity, but I think he generally does care about all of his students and that he tries to be fair overall. If you need to speak with him, find him and just say what you need to say. Educational and enjoyable lectures. Study hard.

Nate is a really good teacher. He is very enthusiastic about his subject which inturn transfers over to the students.He adds alot of personal information from experience and it adds the the whole of the class.he tests are easy enough if you work and have a good memory but there is alot to learn.overall a great class!

this course was hard, but nate will give extra points on tests if you go talk to him. the man is a living encyclopedia. not a favorite with cultural anth kids, but he teaches PHYSICAL anth, don't take the class if you aren't interested. he's passionate about phys anth. very encouraging, WANTS to hear your questions and do projects with you.

A major disappointment. Increasingly went downhill the more he tried to involve human culture. Should stick entirely to physical anthro. Zero writing? Tests? Ridiculous social psych material? Free thinking was discouraged through the fact that there was _a_ right answer. Nate is not meant to teach cultural anthro, and is not informed enough anyway.

I liked him, I liked the material, and I liked the tests.  I found the tests easy but a warning to all you Anthro students- this is an upper division class that didn't have any papers, just tests.  The entire grade was based off of 3 midterms.  Read the material and come to class!  Hard to BS this one.

This is what a real teacher is. Offers students all he can. Helps for ideas for thesis, offers personal copies of outside readings, clear concise, approachable, very helpful. Offers own time to enlighten. Great lectures, great use of modern media. Great use of technology that students use. Hard class, but easy to pass becuase of his teaching skills

nate is encouraging & understanding. his course is difficult, attend every class. but nate is helpful & kind. he wants you to succeed. a mile apart from zihlman: he won't treat you like an idiot for asking questions & tells stories that encourage undergrads to ask them. he talks about his own research, which many profs won't do. a good experience.

During the first few days he seems like he is going to be a really hard tester. After the 1st midterm, it really wasn't that bad and he was willing to re-design all of his tests after that so they would be easier to get pts. Lecture material is interesting and not just memorizing. Really knows his stuff and can be entertaining at times.

Nate's bark is worse than his bite.  He deliberately tried to scare off the students who aren't serious the first few days of class. The material is difficult, but he does his best to make it fun and interesting.

Nate was rather cold and arrogant the first couple days of class, but has warmed up immensely throughout the quarter. tests aren't too bad if you listen for repeated/emphasized concepts in class and take the concurrent lab. very willing to help/clarify if you just ask. enthusiastic and knowledgable. cool videos and many guest lecturers.
